intro: Agave parviflora subsp. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered agave, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features a rosette of thick, blue-green leaves with white marginal teeth. The plant produces a tall flowering stalk with dense clusters of small, white flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
